p: Epimastigote forms of T. cruzi, from a 2- to 4-day-old culture were incubated for 24 h in the absence or in the presence of different concentrations (1000–15.625 µg/mL) of A. rosaeodora essential oil or linalool, obtained by serial dilutions (1:2), at a final volume of 100 µL per well. The controls were identified as blank (wells without parasites), untreated control (parasites and DMSO 1%) and reference drug (benznidazole). Incubation took place in a 96-wells plate, in a BOD incubator at 28 °C in LIT medium using a parasite concentration of 10 6 promastigotes/mL. After 24 h, with the aid of the Neubauer chamber and light microscopy [ 46], viability was evaluated by counting parasites and the results were used to calculate the IC 50 (50% inhibition of parasite growth) following the formula: IC 50 = (sample counting)/(control counting) ×100 [ 47].
